Bharath Kumar
404-424-4429

Java Developer
Professional Summary
Dynamic and Experienced Java application developer, talented Software Engineer with 11+ Years of proven 
expertise in object-oriented analysis, design and exceptional record overseeing all facets of Software 
Development Life Cycle, from analysis and design to implementation and maintenance.
Good expertise in developing Distributed Enterprise Software Application components using object-oriented 
design patterns and Micro Services Architecture.
Experience on Apache Kafka
Known for writing efficient, maintainable, and reusable code that preserves privacy and security.
Extensive experience with Spring Core, Spring IOC, Spring Boot, Spring Data JPA, Spring AOP, Spring Integration 
and Hibernate ORM.
Experienced in Google Cloud and used Googles dataflows for development

and Hibernate ORM.
Experienced in Google Cloud and used Googles dataflows for development

Builder etc.
Expertise in implementing MVC frameworks using Spring, Struts and good knowledge on MVP patterns.
Experience creating Use Case Model, Use Case Diagrams, Class Diagrams, sequence diagrams using Microsoft 
Visio tool.
Expertise in using development tools like My Eclipse, IntelliJ.
Have good understanding on Database technologies for both Relational Database (MySQL, Oracle, PostgreSQL) 
Having understanding on NoSQL DB

Experience on different OS like UNIX, Linux, and Windows operating systems.

TECHNICAL SKILLS
Java/J2EE TechnologyJava Beans, Servlets, JSP, JDBC, EJB, JNDI, JMS, GWT
Architecture & FrameworkClient-Server, MVC, J2EE, Struts, Spring 5, Hibernate, JPA, Micro services, 
Spring Boot

Programming LanguageJava 8, Core Java APIs (I/O, Thread, Collections)
Tools/ServersBEA WebLogic8.1, JBOSS, Tomcat 6.0, JUnit 4
Design & ControlSVN, Bit Bucket, Git

Professional Experience
Client: Disney CA, USAMay 2021 - Current
ProjectRAPI (Retail API)
RoleSenior Java GCP Developer
RAPI is a retail application that basically does the integration between the OMS and the other systems like Inventory etc.
Whenever any order is placed that information will be passed on to inventory application via RAPI to get the inventory 
updates, the same way the inventory sends an acknowledgement back to OMS (Order Management System) to update the 
current inventory details
All this communication happens through the Google’s dataflows which internally uses googles Pub-Sub topic/subscription 
mechanism
Responsibilities
Expertise in Development, Deployment and implementation of Dynamic web applications using Application 
Apache Tomcat in Windows environment.
Implemented Messaging system using Google Cloud Pub/Sub.

Expertise in Development, Deployment and implementation of Dynamic web applications using Application 
Apache Tomcat in Windows environment.
Implemented Messaging system using Google Cloud Pub/Sub.
Extensively used Java 8 features such as lambda expressions, Parallel operations on collections, multithreading 
and for effective sorting mechanisms.
Using Spring Core Annotations for Dependency Injection Spring DI and Spring MVC for REST APIs and Spring Boot 
for Micro Services. 
Used Google dataflows for application development
Worked in an environment where Spring Boot based micro services and Docker container are deployed in 
internal cloud server
Used JIRA extensively for Defect tracking and reporting, made use of Confluence for document management.
Used Google cloud database like Google data stores and Big Query
Analyzed current legacy infrastructure, established business case, and built consensus for virtualized IaaS / PaaS

Used Google cloud database like Google data stores and Big Query
Analyzed current legacy infrastructure, established business case, and built consensus for virtualized IaaS / PaaS 
near term strategy with SaaS mobile cloud services end state.
Behavior Driven Development (BDD) using cutting edge libraries as a more efficient replacement for traditional 
Java integration unit tests.
Worked NOSQL for nonrelation data storage and retrieval.
Using Google code Pipeline 
Experience with Atlassian tools like JIRA, Confluence, Stash, Bamboo build Tracking.
For Continuous Integration used Jenkins mainly to generate and send automatic emails regarding updates on 
project.
Designed and developed the application using Lean-Kanban methodology.
Used JVM Multi-threading part in back-end component, one thread will be running for each user to change the 
inventory in the system according to the user.
Used Streams and Lambda expressions available as part of Java 8 to process the data.

Environment
Java 8, GCP, Google Dataflows, Pub/Sub messaging, Big Query, Spring Boot, Rest web services, Jenkins, Junit, Postman, 
App Engine, Slack, Zoom
ClientADP Atlanta GA, USAFeb 2020 - April 2021 
ProjectHours and Earnings (ADP Payroll project)
RoleLead Java Developer
Hours  and  Earnings  module  basically  creates  the  earning  codes  that  are  used  by  the  ADP’s  core  payroll  calculation 
system which a mainframe application is called Autopay
All  the  core  calculations  are  done  at  Autopay  whereas  the  required  inputs  are  provided  through  the  different 
microservices and one of such microservice is Hours and Earnings
When  an  earning  code  is  created  at  Hours  and  Earnings  module  the  same  will  be  pushed  to  the  Autopay  through  the 
Kafka messaging and saved to the modules internal PostgreSQL DB that is mounted on AWS cloud

Kafka messaging and saved to the modules internal PostgreSQL DB that is mounted on AWS cloud

Client Kemper Insurance FL, USAJan 2017 - Feb 2020
ProjectRPW (Right Price Web)
RoleConsultant Java Developer
RightPriceWeb is the quoting system that calculates the quote price for different line-of-business like Auto, Home and 
Package (combination of Auto & Home)
RPW internally interacts with PLIS (PoLicy Issuance System) mainframe application using Rest API, which takes the inputs 
from RPW and makes all this calculation and returns with the calculated quote amount.
Responsibilities
Involved in the analysis, design, and development and testing phases of Software Development Life Cycle 
(SDLC).
Involved in supporting the application and fixed the bugs.

Involved in the analysis, design, and development and testing phases of Software Development Life Cycle

Client HSBC Bank (CAMP)March 2015 - Dec 2016
ProjectCAMP (Customer Activity Monitoring Program)
RoleConsultant Java Developer
CAMP (Customer Activity Monitoring Program) is an AML (Anti Money Laundering) system which is designed to identify 
the suspicious activities on the transactions within the HSBC bank, main motive behind the scene is not to encourage 
any bad activities and not to encourage anti-social elements.
Responsibilities
Environment monitoring and capturing the data if all the application URLs are healthy
Production support

SSL certification for the different environments
